nodes.bodyText: Why do you expect for 'retry #1' to be found more than 1 time?

We have to be sure that all auto-retoute requests are completed.
Otherwise all requests(for example: retry #2, inactive ISL, switchUp) will be put in the same queue, system pick one of them, and we will not be able to check  that flow is really rerouted after switchUp event.
refactored to /[^a-z_A-Z0-9-\s]* : retry #2 :/
can we do a more meaningful search here?

nodes.bodyText: there is a risk that flows won't find a path during reroute
As for me it makes sense to wait for UP status at least as a separate step/wait here before trying to remove the flow

it can't be done in current implementation.
At the beginning of the test we disabled the flowsRerouteOnIslDiscoveryEnabled feature
So, switch is online, ISLs are not discovered. Then as a result flow reroute on switchUp event are going to fail and flow status is DOWN.
Is this expected? 'retry #' really made sense in the details description, not sure about task id.
As for me "retry #" in task id section is useful to track reroute history in logs. Actually we can duplicate "retry #" to reroute request reason.
I don't have a strong opinion here, just checking that this is not a typo
